conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_A and I’d like to formally apply for your available spot. Nursery_B is my first choice among all nurseries, and we are ready to accept immediately if offered. Thank you for considering my application.

Although Nursery_B ranks me last in its priority list, early application is still my best chance to secure my first preference before capacity is taken, and there is no cost to trying in round 1. I will send a concise but strong application emphasizing commitment and fit.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_A, thank you very much for your application and for your strong interest in Nursery_B. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re not able to offer you our available spot at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the best with your other choices.

In this round, higher-priority candidates Parent_C (#3) and Parent_D (#4) have applied to us, and Parent_E (#1) may still appear later. With quota 1, accepting Parent_A now would block the chance to match with a higher-priority parent. Therefore, reject Parent_A and keep the seat for stronger-priority applicants.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B team—I'm Parent_C and I’m very interested in joining Nursery_B this year. Your program is my first choice, and if offered a place I’m ready to accept promptly. Please let me know if there’s any information you’d like from me to support my application.

With quota 1 and a strong immediate application from Parent_C (who ranks us first), accepting Parent_C secures a high-priority match (3rd overall) rather than risking ending up with a lower-priority or unfilled spot.
